physicalDescription.extent: There is an abstract of contents of the despatch, numbered 1-11, on folios 100-102. These numbers are repeated for reference on the last verso of each enclosure.

mods.abstract: Enclosures to Despatch to the Secret Committee No. 12, dated 11 September 1837.The enclosures relate to changes in the government of Nipaul [Nepal], and consist of reports from the Resident at Catmandhoo [Kathmandu] (Brian Houghton Hodgson), dated 15 June - 21 August 1837.The papers cover: the circumstances surrounding the likely change of administration in Nepal; the death by poison of a child of the Rajah [the King of Nepal, Rajendra Bikram Shah], and the implication in the crime of the Minister, General Bhim Sen [Bhimsen Thapa]; further reports on the state of affairs in Nepal; and replies from the Government of India.
